page.title: 20Coleshill: A Rural Village.
page.content: Coleshill is a rural village, it is miles from anywhere .It has very nice countryside around and is just inside Oxfordshire. The buildings are made from Cotswold stone and there is only one shop in the village, that is the Post Office. The boundary is the river Cole which divides the two counties of Oxfordshire and Wiltshire. All the people who live in Coleshill are very nice and kind. There are about 170 people who live in Coleshill. There used to be a school in Coleshill but because there were not enough children living there to keep it open, it has now closed. Instead of the school, there is now a playgroup with toddlers between the ages of two and five who come from Faringdon, Lechlade and Highworth as well as Coleshill.
